CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1953, pg. 2 reads: " 'Held for Federal Court - Alleged "pushers" and "junkies" nabbed during the recent Hill District narcotics dragnet found the going quite rough before United States Commissioner Harold Lavine last week and this week as they appeared before him on charges of having sold "junk" to Federal undercover agents. The agents' testimony included time, place, amount of dope and identification of the "pushers."  After discovering who one of the undercover agents was, some of the suspects plead guilty.  The rest were held for court on the basis of the damaging testimony and heavy bonds were imposed....Inset, William Crutchfield who waived hearing and was held for court under $10,000 bond...-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Crutchfield wearing double breasted suit and light colored fedora with dark band, awaiting arraignment on narcotics charges in Pittsburgh Federal Courthouse
